text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so soup 
season is about to start here in Vancouver so I

thought I would share with you a recipe for oxtail 
soup so oxtail soup is not something you can find

commonly in Thailand it's available it's a little 
hard to find which is why it's a great thing to

learn how to make at home so soup oxtail soup in 
Thai is called soup haang wua so soup is soup haang wua

means oxtail so it's very straightforward there 
are two main styles of oxtail soup in Thailand

the Thai Muslim style and the more Thai style 
so that the Thai one is what I'm going to show

you today it's a little simpler but they're both 
super delicious let's get started so I got some

beautiful oxtail here so I personally like to pick 
ones that are really big like these are really big

because there's just more meat there something for 
you to chew and I'm just gonna drop my oxtail and

this is just plain water the thing about oxtail 
the reason why it's the perfect soup material

is there so much bone and connective tissue in 
there these will make the richest most luxurious

beef broth ever and hopefully it'll all fit in 
my pot what do you know it's like I planned for

it so while that's going let's talk some aromatics 
for a second so I've got some lemongrass here now

for this particular part I'm going to use just 
the top half which tends to be weaker in flavor

we'll save the bottom half a little bit later I'm 
going to smash it and then we'll let these simmer

with the beef yes I know this knife is incredibly 
dull because it's Adams knife I forgot to bring

my knife don't judge me so these go into the 
beef so this beef is going to cook for two and a

half hours at first just to get it tender and the 
reason why Thai people like to add some herbs at

this stage is because these herbs sort of help 
mitigate the gay meanness of beef to be honest

I find that the Hale in Canada has none of that 
smell that gamy smell at all but in Thailand they

seem to be have a stronger smell so people like 
to put lots of herbs in there while it's simmering

so it's completely up to you so in it in addition 
to some lemongrass I'm also gonna throw in kaffir

lime leaves as well and I think one of the reasons 
why exhale in Thailand has more of a stronger

smells because they're usually sold with the 
skin on whereas here the oxtails don't come with

the skin so maybe that's what the difference is 
I'm not sure but in any case while the oxtail is

simmering you want to give it some seasoning some 
saltiness so that it can absorb that flavor while

it's cooking so I'm gonna add some fish sauce and 
that's it let it simmer gently for two-and-a-half

hours that will depend slightly on the size of 
your oxtail buttocks hair really needs a lot

of time so if you want to stick this in a slow 
cooker or pressure cooker this would be a good

recipe to do that for look at that you just know 
that is an incredibly rich broth and I've had to

by the way top this up with more water as it went 
now I'm gonna fish out all these herbs now which

have been completely spent and this is by the way 
just the scum and the fat that I've been skimming

throughout this period this is also one of those 
dishes I often make over two days so the first day

I'll do this the two and a half hours part I'll 
put it in the fridge I don't even need to skim the

fat then I'll just scrape the fat off the top once 
it comes out of the fridge and then you continue

the rest later so it's up to you if you plan ahead 
okay so now we're gonna move up this broth with

more things so the onion I'm adding at this point 
and I'm gonna let it go until it basically is soft

and sweet it's going to be what keeps this broth 
sweet I'm not adding any sugar whatsoever some

Tomatoes so I've got some chopped tomatoes here 
again with the tomatoes the plan is that they

will completely disintegrate into the broth and 
will add flavor at mommy add a little acidity I'm

gonna let it cook for another 30 minutes and then 
we're so close to being done so the onions and the

tomatoes have softened completely the tomatoes 
have like disintegrated exactly what you want

now all the herbs are gonna go in this is where 
the soup gets really delicious so that lemongrass

bottoms that we saved which is the stronger 
part of the lemongrass some ginger slices yes

so typically like you will see me use galangal 
in a soup but ginger and beef just go so well

together and it seems to be like the classic makes 
for oxtail soup in Thailand and I really love this

combination too some ginger and of course lots and 
lots of lime leaves extra lime leaves gonna give

that a tear and a brew saw the fragrant juices 
come out if you want to make this spicy I'm gonna

throw in some Thai chilies I just cut them in half 
on a bias but I'm keeping them in big pieces so no

one accidentally eats one so we're gonna give this 
another 15 to 20 minutes for the herbs to do their

thing and then it's pretty much done like it's 
super easy so the if you've been doing math you're

gonna know that the total amount of time that 
you want the beef to cook is three hours three

hours and a little bit so the minimum amount of 
time for the oxtail of that size to become super

tender is three hours and then we're basically 
just working backwards adding ingredients all

right we'll be right back mmm now it's starting to 
smell really good so I'm gonna turn this off and

I'm gonna give it a taste and a just seasoning 
oh that's so good oh that broth is so rich but

it does need more fish sauce or salt at this 
point you can add whatever you want still need

to add some lime juice to this you could have it 
like this but a lot of times with oxtail soup in

Thailand the lime is served separately so you can 
choose to have it just kind of like this or really

tart and zingy with a little extra line which is 
how I like to do it so we're gonna serve that on

the side so if you're feeling like it needs a 
little zing don't worry though zing is coming

before we serve going to add some extra tomatoes 
just so that there's you know some meat not me

there's plenty of meat there are some substantial 
chunks of tomatoes that people can eat and then I

usually like to let this simmer for another two 
to three minutes if you're gonna sort of serve

this right away not too - there's just one minute 
just to stop in the tomato but if you're not gonna

serve it right away usually if you just let the 
tomato sit in here the residual heat is enough

by the time you're gonna serve it you're gonna 
reheat it the tomatoes will be nice and soft

a little extra cilantro shower and that is it 
let's serve it up look at that's monstrous peas

and the meat starting to fall off which is exactly 
what I want because that means it's super tender

now for me I always like to do a nice squeeze of 
lime to make this like a tangy soup as much as you

want and by the way for our patreon members 
for the show after the show I'm gonna talk

you through how you would modify this into the 
more Muslim version the Muslim style of oxtail

soup and if you wanna join our patreon club 
check out the link in the description below

you want to get oh my god look at that meat 
take a bite with some broth and some beef

just have to take more than one sip that bra it's 
bright with the lime and all the citrusy herbs

that we added but it's also rich and unctuous this 
is how you know this broth is rich you put that

in the fridge and it's going to come out solid 
like more solid than any jello you make because

there's so much connective tissue that broth is 
filled with collagen with gelatin sorry which is

really good for you as well so you want to really 
drink up that broad lots of good protein it's just

so delicious you can put rice in it and have it 
like a rice soup or I usually just eat it on its

own it's just so good so the recipe as always will 
be on hot Thai Kitchen comm and when you make it

I definitely want to see a photo send it to me

Pinterest now for those of you who are pinners and 
if you haven't subscribed to the show make sure

you do so you don't miss an episode and click the

post a new video thanks as always for watching and 
I will see you next time for your next delicious
